components.name: Frontend
components.description: A web interface (likely React or similar) allowing users to input prompts and view generated images. Handles user interaction and displays results.

components.name: Backend API
components.description: A REST API (e.g., Python/Flask, Node.js/Express) that receives prompts from the frontend, interacts with the diffusion model, and returns the generated images.  Handles authentication and authorization.

components.name: Diffusion Model
components.description: The core AI model responsible for generating images from text prompts.  This is likely a pre-trained model hosted externally (e.g., on a cloud platform like AWS Sagemaker or Google Cloud Vertex AI).

components.name: Database
components.description: Stores user data (if any), prompt history, and potentially image metadata.  Could be a relational database (PostgreSQL, MySQL) or a NoSQL database (MongoDB).

data_flows.description: User input (text prompt) is sent from the frontend to the backend API.
The backend API forwards the text prompt to the diffusion model for image generation.
The diffusion model returns the generated image to the backend API.
The backend API sends the generated image back to the frontend for display.

trust_boundaries.name: User Input Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The frontend and backend API trust user-provided text prompts.  This boundary is highly vulnerable to prompt injection attacks.

trust_boundaries.name: Diffusion Model Trust Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The diffusion model itself is a third-party service. Trust relies on the security practices of the hosting provider.
